intro: Hieracium sigmoideum, commonly known as the zigzag hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems with hairy surfaces and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, producing yellow flowers that are arranged in a compact cluster. The species is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
